intro: Sterculia ensifolia, commonly known as the sword-leaf sterculia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
